txt.en: Your carelessness in slaying the Huorns who serve Blackthorn has likely cost the Rohirrim a powerful ally. You should speak with Blackthorn and try to convince him to help.

'You are reckless, little [placeholder]. Hoom, you have slaughtered Huorns both friendly and corrupted without regard to their nature. Perhaps I was hasty to save young Thane BÃ©ortnoth...the people of Rohan are violent and savage.\n\n'Return to your folk and tell them that the forest will not harm them, but neither will it help. Ta-rum! Go now!'
'Walking trees and Ents? Are you mad? No one would believe such a ridiculous tale.\n\n'Ah well, perhaps I was wrong about the shadows in the trees....'
The Ent Blackthorn was roused to anger by your reckless slaughter of his Huorns.
Your carelessness in slaying the Huorns has likely cost a powerful ally. You should speak with Blackthorn and try to convince him to help.
Your carelessness in slaying the Huorns who serve Blackthorn has likely cost the Rohirrim a powerful ally. You should speak with Blackthorn and try to convince him to help.

Blackthorn has chosen to ignore the needs of the Rohirrim, but at least you can assure Herehasen that the shadows of Fangorn will not harm his people.\n\nYou should speak with Blackthorn before returning to Herehasen.
Herehasen is at Tordag's camp in the Broadacres, south of the eaves of Fangorn.\n\nBlackthorn sent you back to Herehasen with his refusal to help the Rohirrim.
Your carelessness in slaying the Huorns who serve Blackthorn has likely cost the Rohirrim a powerful ally. You should speak with Blackthorn and try to convince him to help.
Talk to Herehasen at Tordag's camp
